data.title: Duke Fuqua MBA - Class Profile 2024
data.meta_description: In this article we take a look at the class profile and employment reports of the Duke Fuqua MBA Program at the Fuqua School of Business.
data.meta_site_name: e-GMAT Blog | Best GMAT blog on the planet
data.text:
A 4 min read

On the edge of the vast expanses of Duke Forest, in Durham, North Carolina, lies the 12-acre campus of Duke Fuqua School of Business, one of the elite business schools in the United States of America. Founded in 1838 and named after philanthropist J. B. Fuqua, the school enrols more than 1500 students a year into its 7-degree programs, which include a Full-Time MBA, a Global Executive MBA and a Weekend MBA.

What it may lack in immediate brand recognition, especially among international applicants, Duke Fuqua MBA Program makes up for in its obsessive focus on core values and attempts to create a tight-knit community among its alumni, faculty, students and their families. With a network of more than 22,000 alumni, Duke Fuqua has one of the largest alumni bases in the world, surpassed only by a handful of schools.

This article will help you in researching the class profile and employment reports of the Full-Time MBA Program at the Duke Fuqua School of Business. Following is a brief outline of this article:

Trivia about the Duke Fuqua School of Business

Some Trivia about the Duke Fuqua School of Business

Possibly the most often mispronounced top business school, its name is actually pronounced few-kwa

B. Fuqua, the philanthropist after whom the school is named, wrote to several schools as an impoverished young boy asking for free study material. Duke University is the only school that responded. He gave a $40 million donation to the school later in his life as a gift for believing in him.

Fuqua Faculty has been consistently ranked #1 for intellectual capital by Bloomberg Businessweek

Durham has been ranked the #1 city for millennials by Forbes magazine

General Information on the Duke Fuqua School of Business

Location: 100 Fuqua Drive, Durham, NC 27708, USA

Dean: Bill Boulding

Admissions Office: Phone: +1 919-660-7705

Hours: Monday to Friday, 8:30 am – 5 pm Eastern Time

Email: admissions-info@fuqua.duke.edu

Social Media: Facebook, Linkedin, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube

Duke Fuqua MBA Program – Class profile 2024, Cost of Attendance, Salary

Fuqua sees itself as a General Management program, one which is not specialized in any industry and has a curriculum to match. The highly customizable curriculum has only 13 mandated core classes and provides the flexibility to choose from more than 100 electives so the program becomes highly personalized. The Full-Time MBA program also offers students exciting opportunities to develop their abilities beyond the classroom through a wide array of experiential learning opportunities. Whether you desire to be a consultant or an entrepreneur, Fuqua’s immersive learning initiatives will enable you to apply classroom learning to real-world experiences.

Mentioned below are the basic statistics for Fuqua’s Full-Time MBA Program. Since the MBA Admission process is so competitive, it may benefit potential applicants to have statistics in the 80% range of the school they wish to apply to.

Duke Fuqua MBA: Incoming Class Profile 2024

Fuqua’s current class is a truly diverse selection of incredibly talented individuals. The school also represents minorities (43%) and under-represented minorities (25%) generously.

Pre-MBA Industries of Duke Fuqua MBA Incoming Class of 2024

Presented below are the pre-MBA backgrounds of the students in the current class of Fuqua School of Business. While Consulting and Financial Services backgrounds are heavily favoured, one may notice the eclectic selection of students from various careers. This shows that there’s truly no one right path to Fuqua.

2022 - 2023 Duke Fuqua MBA Application Deadlines

Fuqua experimented with an early action round this year. The deadlines for each round and the decision dates are mentioned below.

Duke Fuqua MBA Program: Employment and Salaries- 2022

Duke Fuqua MBA: Employment by Job Function

As is standard for most elite business schools, the graduating class of Fuqua reported a median annual salary of $160,055 with an average $30,000 sign-on bonus. An impressive 98% of the graduating class was employed within 3 months of graduation.

Duke Fuqua MBA: Employment by Industry

Duke Fuqua School of Business: Employment by Region

Some of the largest companies in the world hire directly from Fuqua’s campus. Other Fortune 100 companies are known to hire Fuqua graduates off-campus as well.

Duke Fuqua School of Business – Notable Alumni

Following are some notable alumni of the Duke Fuqua School of Business:

Tim Cook, CEO of Apple, Inc.

Melinda Gates, co-founder of The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation

Bruce Johnson, former CEO of Sears Holdings Corporation

Malvinder Mohan Singh, former CEO of Ranbaxy Labs

Johnathan Browning, former CEO of Volkswagen Group

Ranjana Clark, CTO MUFG America

Jack O. Bovender Jr., CEO of Hospital Corporation of America

Christian Van Thillo, CEO De Persgroep

Michael Lamach, Ingersoll Rand

John Kogan, CEO Illumeo

Other programs you may consider

Other schools that are a close match to Fuqua with regards to the competitiveness of the selection process, rankings, employability of graduates and brand image are:

Stretch Schools: MIT Sloan, Columbia, Northwestern Kellogg

Match Schools: Michigan Ross, NYU Stern, UVA Darden
